core.utils package

Submodules

forge.core.utils.aliases module

Aliases for various types used within Forge that do not need to be exposed.

forge.core.utils.base module

Various base classes for Forge to organize code.

class forge.core.utils.base.Renderable(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Protocol

Base renderable class for Forge.

add_to_renderer(renderer_name: str = 'display-object-renderer') → None

Add the object to a renderer.

Parameters

renderer_name (str) – Name of the renderer to which the object is to be added; defaults to the base object renderer.

render(display: Surface) → None

Render the object to the display.

Parameters

display (forge.core.utils.aliases.Surface) – Display to which the object is to be rendered.

forge.core.utils.dispatch module

Custom function-overloading in Python using Python decorators with type-hints.

forge.core.utils.dispatch.multidispatch(*types: Type)

Decorator for class methods using type-hints enabling, function-overloading using dynamic dispatch.

Parameters

types (tuple[Type]) – Types to be overloaded.

forge.core.utils.exceptions module

Custom exceptions in Forge.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.BodyAreaError(area: float, min_body_area: float, max_body_area: float)

Bases: Exception

Body size does not comply with specified world limits.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.BodyDensityError(density: float, min_body_density: float, max_body_density: float)

Bases: Exception

Body density does not comply with specified world limits.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.ClampError

Bases: Exception

Values passed to be clamped are logically incorrect.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.EventNameError(message: str)

Bases: Exception

Event with the given name already exists.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.EventNotRegisteredError(message: str)

Bases: Exception

Event with the given name or ID has not been registered.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.IDNotFoundError(id_: int)

Bases: Exception

ID has not been registered for a Forge object.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.InternalEventDeletionError(event_name: str)

Bases: Exception

Internal events cannot be deleted using their names.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.InternalEventRetrievalError(event_name: str)

Bases: Exception

Internal events cannot be retrieved using their names.

exception forge.core.utils.exceptions.RGBAColorError(red: int, blue: int, green: int, alpha: int)

Bases: Exception

Invalid RGBA color arguments.

forge.core.utils.id module

Forge’s ID system. The uniqueness of each ID is maintained on a global, project-wide level.

forge.core.utils.id.delete_id(id_: int) → None

Delete an ID making it free to be randomly generated again. Often used when an object associated with the given ID is also deleted.

Parameters

id (int) – ID to be deleted.

Raises

forge.core.utils.exceptions.IDNotFoundError – An ID must be registered if it is to be deleted.

forge.core.utils.id.generate_random_id(length: int = 8) → int

Generate a new unique random ID of a given length.

Parameters

length (int) – Length of the ID to be generated.

Returns

New random and unique ID.

Return type

int

forge.core.utils.loaders module

Loaders for various assets in Forge.

forge.core.utils.loaders.load_internal_events(*skip_events: InternalEvent) → None

Load all internal Forge events.

Parameters

skip_events – Enum names of internal events to be skipped during the loading.

Type

forge.core.managers.event.InternalEvent

forge.core.utils.loaders.load_sprites_from_folders(path: str) → list[forge.core.engine.sprite.Sprite]

Load files from various nested sub-folders as Forge sprites.

Parameters

path (str) – Base or parent folder path.

Returns

List of all sprites loaded from the sub-folders.

Return type

list[forge.core.engine.sprite.Sprite]

forge.core.utils.math module

Core mathematical functions for Forge.

forge.core.utils.math.clamp(value: int | float, min_: int | float, max_: int | float) → int | float

Clamp a value between a specified minimum and maximum bound.

Parameters

  • value (int | float) – Value to be clamped.

  • min (int | float) – Minimum bound of the clamp.

  • max (int | float) – Maximum bound of the clamp.

Returns

Value to be clamped to the minimum and maximum bound.

Return type

int | float

Raises

ValueError – The maximum bound cannot be greater than the minimum bound.
